reviews.text: When ever we need some peace we can go and sit and feed the fish ur mind will be refreshed. compare to old now new reconstructed was so awesome.
Such a beautiful place.. very peaceful and Nithya annadanam is there here.
Who wants to see the GOD peacefully and to experience the temple environment Go except Saturday. It's an amazing place.

Amalapuram most famous temple
Sri Venkateswara Swamy
Temple

Venkateswara Swami Temple in Amalapuram is a famous Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Venkateswara, also known as Balaji or Govinda.
The main deity of the temple, Lord Venkateswara, is depicted in a standing posture with four hands, holding a discus, a conch shell, a lotus flower, and a mace. The idol is adorned with richly embroidered clothes and jewelry, and is placed on a high pedestal inside the sanctum sanctorum.
The temple attracts thousands of devotees from all over India, especially during the annual Brahmotsavam festival, which is celebrated for nine days in the month of September or October. During this time, the temple is beautifully decorated with flowers and lights, and various rituals and processions are held to honor Lord Venkateswara.
Apart from its religious significance, the Venkateswara Swami Temple is also known for its cultural heritage. The temple hosts several cultural programs and events throughout the year, including classical music and dance performances, religious discourses, and festivals celebrating the rich cultural heritage of Andhra Pradesh.

places_with_reviews.name: Clock Tower

reviews.text: It is one of the heavily crowded areas in this town. The newly built clock tower looks pretty stylish too. It barely remains a landmark with no obvious historical significance but the connect it had with people of this town stands it apart from other monuments.

A most important landmark in amalapuram town..little bit conjusted with traffic...And one of the main shopping centers in the town.recwntly renovation work is in progress. The old clock tower is dismantled and construction of the new clock tower is in progress. The new clock tower looks appealing and may be expected to be completed in next few months.
A nice place in the heart of the city. A very old landmark, which has been renovated recently and has nice additions such as fountains, color changing lights etc..

Nice place usually a common place for gatherings meetings and dharnas.
Here parking is some times risky. They send chalanas. Recently renovated.
Heart of Amalapuram.... The Old one is replaced and now it's newly constructed with our national flag beside... And we can see I ❤️ AMALAPURAM here.... With all the facilities like shops and all....

places_with_reviews.name: Amaleswara Swamy Temple
places_with_reviews.address: H243+8XW, Rollapalem, Amalapuram, Andhra Pradesh 533201, India

reviews.text: This is the temple which is the reason behind the formation of the name AMALAPURAM,i.e Amaleswara swamy  temple.Every Saturday there is annadhanam and its is nearly 2 to 3 kms from amalapuram.Rollapalem is the place where temple located and there is no parking for cars beside the temple,you have to park it in walkable distance from there .Every day abhishekam facility provided.along with god shiva and godess parvathi also ganapathi,hanuma,naga bandanalu and 2 to 3 worship trees are there to worship.finally you will definitely enjoy the nature and village atmosphere there!!

We can  observe such an oldest lingam here
You may feel lotd Siva blessings here.
